723427f-a.title: Manhattan: State Street - Bridge Street
723427f-a.text:
State Street, north from Bridge Street to Battery Place,
showing the old ''E1' spur upon same. This carries the Sixth
and the Ninth Avenue Elevted Lines to South Ferry. On the
left is Battery Park; on the right, the U. S. Custom House;
and in the background, the early Washington Building. Behind
the latter and facing Bowling Greea, is the towering Cunard
Building. Broadway begins at that point.
1905
George L. Balgue
MAY BE REPRODUCED
723427f-a.folder: State Street & Bridge Street, Manhattan, NY

722481f-a.title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - State Street
722481f-a.text:
Pearl Street, south side, east from but not including State, to and
inclding Whitehall Streets. (Pearl Street, runs east and west from
State Street, to Coenties Slip).
August 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.
722481f-a.folder: Pearl Street & State Street, Manhattan, NY

723428f-b.title: Manhattan: State Street - Bridge Street
723428f-b.text:
(u)
16 to 19 State Street, east side, between Bridge Street and Bowling
Green, showing in the foreground, a portion of Battery Park. The house on
the extreme left, is the rear of No. 7 Bowling Green, at the S.E. corner of
State Street. These houses have long since been demolished, and on its site
how (1937), stands the United States Custom House.
About 1861.
Erown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, at a later date and showing demolition. On the left appears
the rears of houses that face on Bowling Green. Note the Produce Exchange
in the background.
Date----f
Eugene E. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
723428f-b.folder: State Street & Bridge Street, Manhattan, NY

723425f-b.title: Manhattan: State Street - Pearl Street
723425f-b.text:
(1)
State Street, at Searl Street and viewing northwestward towards
the Sorth (Hudson) Siver to show the ''hitehall Suildings. On
the left is Eattery Park and the ticket booth of the S.I. ferry.
To the right appears the curved front of the Chesebroungh Build-
ing, No. 15-19 State Street at the S.N.corner of Pearl Street.
Note that this thoroughfare veers northwards from this point.
July 4, 1937
P.L.Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
State Street, after ''I' demolition, showing the Whitehall
Down Town Athletic Club and United Fruit Company Buildinge.
P. L. Sperr  May 4, 1941
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(3)
State Street near Pearl after ''L,'' demolition, ahowing White-
hall Building, Down Town Athletic Building and Dnited Fruit
Company Buildinga.
P. L. Sperr  January 8, 1941
NO REPRODUCTIONS
723425f-b.folder: State Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY
